result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Justin A Habeck

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Justin A Habeck
Current: 1019 Arlington Place, Stevens Point, WI 54481 United States  (Effective: 02-23-2017)
Prior: 78 Big Oak Ct., Wisconsin Rapids, WI 54494

Defendant Justin A Habeck in court with attorney Brandon Kuhl. Defendant Justin A Habeck in custody. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
All files heard: (Sentencing) 13CF319, 13CF325  (Plea/sentencing) 14CF397, 14CF398
10:49 a.m.  Court calls the cases. 

14CF398 - Court notes there is no information filed.  Reviews the file.  No waiver of preliminary hearing or information has been filed. 
Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions Attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 
The State will file an information today. 
Defendant agrees to proceed today. 

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
 14CF398 Counts 1 & 2 - NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty Counts 1 & 2.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
14CF398 Count 3 and 14CF397 are dismissed and read-in. 

The Court and both counsel have received the PSI in 13CF319 & 13CF325. 
Atty Constable makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Kuhl makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

BY THE COURT:
13CF319 - 
Sentence withheld. 
Placed on probation for a period of 3 years:
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.
AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.
Maintain fulltime employment. 
No contact with Jesse Merrill except for related child issues and with agent approval. 
Sign all releases of information for the agent.
Obtain all prescriptions from one pharmacy. 
Pay costs including the DNA surcharge. 
If revoked, 376 days credit. 

13CF325  Count 1 -
Sentence withheld. 
Placed on probation for a period of 3 years, concurrent:
Comply with conditions on 13CF319.
Pay costs including the DNA surcharge. 
If revoked, 376 days credit. 

13CF325 Count 2 - 
Sentence withheld. 
Placed on probation for a period of 3 years, concurrent:
Comply with conditions on Count 1 & 13CF319. 
Pay costs including the DNA surcharge. 

14CF398 Count 1 -
Sentence withheld. 
Placed on probation for a period of 3 years, concurrent:
Comply with the conditions on 13CF319 & 13CF325.
Pay costs. 
Pay restitution of $527.84. 

14CF398 Count 2 - 
Sentence withheld. 
Placed on probation for a period of 1 year, concurrent:
Comply with conditions on Count 1, 13CF319 & 13CF325. 
Pay costs.
Pre-trial conference on March 23, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Justin A Habeck appeared by video. Prosecuting Atty Cass W Cousins appeared for State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard are 13CF-319, 13CF-325, 14CF-397 and 14CF-398.

1:06 PM Court calls cases.
Court states appearances.

This is a return on warrant hearing.

Defendant failed to appear at a sentencing hearing, Court issued bench warrants, body only. Defendant has been arrested. Atty Sheila Kessler has withdrawn from the case. Defendant will need to contact the public defender's office.

Atty Cousins addresses the Court, a PSI was requested but the agent did not have contact with the Defendant.

BY THE COURT:
Bond is REVOKED on all cases.

Cases are to be taken to Branch 2 to schedule a sentencing hearing.

Court advises Defendant to contact public defender's office. 

**Clerk to advise probation and parole that Defendant is incarcerated to complete PSI**

Body Only.
sent to JR 11/10/14 ks

Defendant Justin A Habeck not in court. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Both files heard: 14CF397, 14CF398
Atty Knaapen indicates the summons and complaints were mailed to the last known address and were not returned.  This defendant has outstanding warrants. 
Court notes he received an email re: obsconding from day report. 

BY THE COURT:  Court finds complaint shows probable cause.  Bench Warrant.  Body Only on each file. 
Defendant was to be here at 1:30.  It is now 2:34 p.m.
